Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Adegan
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: Adegan crystals, also called Ilum crystals, are one of the most common lightsaber focusing crystals.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Rubat
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: Used in lightsaber construction, rubat crystal is mined on Phemis. It produces a clearly defined blade that a Jedi can easily focus on.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Ruusan
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: Ruusan crystals come from the Mid Rim planet of the same name. While not directly affecting a lightsaber's effectiveness, they aid a Jedi in focusing the Force.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Velmorite
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: Found only on the planet Velmor, these crystals produce a very fine beam that is easy to wield skillfully.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Sigil
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: Mined in the Sigil System, this crystal is a costly but valued addition to a lightsaber. It produces a fiercely bright beam that sears on contact, inflicting great damage.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Nextor
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: This crystal is mined in the mountains of planet M'haeli, and when used in lightsaber construction it produces a volatile blade that can cause surprising amounts of damage.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Kasha
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: This crystal is traditionally used by the Cereans as a meditation tool. When used as a lightsaber crystal, it helps clear the wielder's mind of distractions, even during tense combat.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Eralam
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: Once mined on the third moon of Erai, ancient Sith bombardment shattered much that remained. If they can be found, these crystals produce a clear, superior lightsaber beam.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Damind
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: Found on the desert world of Daminia, this crystal can be used in lightsaber construction to produce a clearly defined beam of subtly wider width and length.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Sapith
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: This crystallized material was excreted once every 11 years by the ancient Volice worm of Lwhekk, now extinct. It produces a more intense lightsaber beam, granting better control.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Opila
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: Found in the asteroid fields of the Fyrth system, this crystal can be used in lightsaber construction to produce an intense beam that seems extraordinarily quick to the cut.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Upari
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: Strangely, this crystal is usually encountered scattered in the orbit of primarily forest worlds. It is brittle but versatile, and a Master Jedi can get it to produce many effects.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Lorrdian Gemstone
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: Strangely, this crystal is usually encountered scattered in the orbit of primarily forest worlds. It is brittle but versatile, and a Master Jedi can get it to produce many effects.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Ankarres Sapphire
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: This crystal possesses legendary healing powers and numerous other effects. It is one of the most potent crystals that can be used in lightsaber creation.

Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.label: Crystal, Kaiburr
Lightsaber.HiltPartDef.description: Perhaps the most powerful crystal that can be used in a lightsaber, the Kaiburr gem bestows insight and fortitude upon its owner.
